Simply an amazing game for pure fun and some stress relief!

This game is a pile of steaming garbage, The Developers refuse to fix the broken game ruining bugs that occur every single time a new chapter releases. It is obscenely grind-y at the time of writing this review I have 1,000 hours in the game and have been playing for about two years and have barely scratched the surface of what they expect you to get. 

They care more about releasing overpriced cosmetics then actually fixing their abysmal spaghetti code that makes the game quite literally unplayable sometimes. The community is as toxic as my relationship, You will be lucky to go three or four games without having someone be annoyed at something you did that you didn't even actually do no matter who you're playing as and of course that always devolves into all forms of phobic/ist comments.

The game is a mess... but its a fun mess... most of the time, if you don't take it too seriously 

TL;DR: The game is broken, It's usually fun despite this. Play with friends for a better experience!

I've been playing this game for the better part of the last five years, and while I can say that it has been an extremely mixed bag with regard to both the community and the dev team's handling of the game, it has been the one game I've returned to over and over again without fail. Nothing quite compares to it and despite balance issues (which are to be expected in an asymmetrical multiplayer game) the gameplay still slaps.

The one caveat I have to give is that when I began playing, the game was a lot smaller and maybe a bit easier to digest. BHVR has expanded their roster a lot over the lifetime of this game and, as of writing, there are 30 survivor characters and 27 killers, all with 3 unique perks each for a total of 171 perks to read through and understand, with some perks STRONGLY influencing the outcome of matches over others. And this isn't to mention items, add-ons, offerings, and each individual killer's power which certain game mechanics are hinged on... the point is, if you're jumping in now, there's a lot to learn and the curve is steep. Expect to spend a lot of time (read: over 1000 hours) if you want to master the meta and learn the ropes.

But with that all said, I do still highly recommend Dead by Daylight, especially for fans of the horror genre. BHVR's asymmetrical multiplayer experience is brimming with atmosphere, fun nods to some of our favorite horror icons, and a host of original characters and lore to fall in love with. Check it out.
